page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: TALYBONT 40 YEARS AGO 40 years ago there were more people in Talybont than there are now,that was mainly due to the lead mining industry at Allt y Crib and the mountains above Talybont.At that time Welsh was the language spoken by most people.There were 12 shops in the village where as now there are only 3.There were 3 chapels and 1 church but 40 years ago many more people attended the services.The smithy in the village was a very busy place as so many farmers depended on horses,and on the Square there was a bakery where everybody brought their bread to be baked.There was also 2 woollen mills and a flour mill,all depending on water from the 2 rivers.One of the highlights of the year was the Talybont Fair held on the Square where farmers bargained for servants for the year.
